channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Microsoft drops its observer seat on OpenAI board amid regulatory scrutiny
item.description: Microsoft took a nonvoting board seat at OpenAI back in November.

item.title: 'Blowout' in French borrowing costs still to come amid economic deadlock, veteran investor says
item.description: "Political paralysis in France is economic paralysis in France," David Roche told CNBC.

item.title: China is leading on GenAI experimentation, but lags U.S. in implementation, survey shows
item.description: Chinese companies lead the world in general generative AI use but are still behind the U.S. in full implementation, a new survey finds.

item.title: Fed Chair Powell says holding rates high for too long could jeopardize economic growth
item.description: Setting the stage for a two-day appearance on Capitol Hill, the central bank leader said the economy remains strong as does the labor market.

item.title: China's inflation numbers miss expectations, rising 0.2% in June
item.description: China's consumer price inflation rose by 0.2% in June from a year ago, missing expectations, while producer prices fell in-line with forecasts.

item.title: 'Don't get tired': Samsung Electronics workers extend strike indefinitely, say chip production disrupted
item.description: This is the first strike by the labor union in Samsung Electronics' entire 55-year history, according to local media.

item.title: Locusts in your noodles? Singapore approves 16 insect species as food
item.description: The agency said the following list of approved bugs can be imported for both human consumption and animal feed for food producing animals.

item.title: An investment banker quit her job to become a YouTuber and now makes over $1 million
item.description: An investment banker who quit her job to become a YouTuber — just two months before a six-figure bonus — now has over 1 million subscribers.

item.title: Barcelona protesters throw items and spray travelers with water while shouting ‘tourists go home’
item.description: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.

item.title: This is the most affordable country for expats in 2024, according to a new report
item.description: Vietnam was ranked No. 1 in terms of personal finances for expats, according to InterNation's Expat Insider 2024 report.

item.title: China’s ETF market sees ‘explosive’ growth, inflows jump 5-fold in three years, Morningstar says
item.description: Chinese exchange-traded funds saw a "staggering" growth in the last few years, with inflows consistently notching new highs, according to Morningstar.

item.title: Biden announces new NATO aid for Ukraine, as his reelection campaign teeters
item.description: President Biden is scheduled to deliver a press conference Thursday following NATO summit events.

item.title: Japan and Philippines' defense pact seeks to counter China's aggression in the region, experts say
item.description: Japan and the Philippines have signed a landmark defense pact, allowing exchanges of armed forces for training and military exercises amid China concerns.

item.title: Greece defends new six-day working week legislation, says it's an 'exceptional measure'
item.description: After facing backlash for introducing a new six-day working week, Greece has defended the policy, saying it would be an “exceptional measure.”

item.title: Singapore state investor Temasek to focus on early adopters of AI in the U.S.; cautious on China
item.description: The state investor said that the U.S. will still be the largest destination for its capital, although it is also looking to increase its focus on India and Japan.

item.title: Iran has voted in a reformist president — but change remains distant
item.description: Despite Pezeshkian's stated support for relaxing things like headscarf penalties, Iran-focused human rights groups are not optimistic.

item.title: Stolen crypto doubled to $1.38 billion in the first half of 2024, research firm says
item.description: Crypto valued at $1.38 billion was stolen by hackers from Jan. 1 to June 24, up from $657 million during the year-earlier period, TRM Labs data showed.

item.title: First Ariane 6 rocket launches as Europe rejoins a market dominated by Musk's SpaceX
item.description: The European Space Agency has prepared its newest heavy-lift Ariane 6 rocket to launch from Europe's Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana, on Tuesday.

item.title: Vacuum cleaner manufacturer Dyson to cut around 1,000 jobs in the UK
item.description: Dyson is set to cut up to 1,000 jobs in the U.K., where it employs 4,500 people.

item.title: UiPath to lay off 10% of workforce in companywide restructuring
item.description: Software developer UiPath will cut 10% of its workforce, or about 420 jobs, as part of a broader company restructuring.

item.title: France's Macron wanted to leave his mark on Europe — he may have just ruined his legacy
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron's failed snap election gamble is likely to take a huge toll on his political ambitions and legacy, analysts say.

item.title: Biden needs to show he's 'with it' at 'extraordinarily important' NATO summit, former diplomat says
item.description: Particular focus during the summit will be on President Joe Biden amid widespread concerns about his age and mental fitness for the presidential race.

item.title: BP shares drop 4.3% after warning of up to $2 billion impairment, weak refining margins
item.description: BP on Tuesday said it expects to post an impairment of up to $2 billion in the second quarter, also warning of lower refining margins.

item.title: The sting of an Airbnb rejection: Hosts explain why they turn down all sorts of travelers
item.description: Social media, credit cards that don't match booking names, and even 4.5-star reviews can cause short-term rental hosts to reject travelers outright.

item.title: Inflation outrage: Even as prices stabilize, Walmart, Chipotle and others feel the heat from skeptical customers
item.description: Customers' deep frustration with higher prices has pushed many retailers and restaurants to step up discounts, promotions and value meals.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Are markets too optimistic?
item.description: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at all-time highs; Elliott threatens proxy fight, Germany’s bitcoin sale pressures prices

item.title: 'No one is picking up the phone': Joe Biden's fundraising confronts new hurdles after debate
item.description: President Joe Biden's fundraising is showing some signs of struggle, despite his insistence that he'll stay in the race.

item.title: Japan stocks and India's Nifty 50 hit fresh highs as Asia-Pacific markets rise
item.description: Asia-Pacific markets rose on Tuesday, tracking gains on Wall Street that saw the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite closing at record highs overnight.

item.title: 'Make or break week:' Stifel sees 40% chance of President Biden dropping out of the race
item.description: Brian Gardner, Stifel's chief Washington policy strategist, said it is a "make or break week" for President Joe Biden's campaign.

item.title: San Francisco's AI boom can't stop real estate slide, as office vacancies reach new record
item.description: Office vacancies in San Francisco hit another record in the second quarter, and rent prices fell to their lowest since 2015, according to Cushman & Wakefield.
